title: Age of Hockey Greats vs. Goals by Year
text:
This visualization maps the careers of the NHL’s top 50 all-time goal scorers, revealing the crucial distinction between elite efficiency and career longevity. By plotting total career goals against games played, the chart clearly separates the ‘sprinters’ from the ‘marathon runners.’ The bright, large markers highlight legendary figures like Wayne Gretzky and Alex Ovechkin, who occupy the upper echelon of the chart due to their massive goal totals. In contrast, players like Mario Lemieux appear in the upper-left quadrant, demonstrating incredible scoring rates (high goal totals in fewer games), while icons like Gordie Howe and Jaromír Jágr extend far to the right, showcasing careers built on remarkable durability and sustained excellence over decades. The grey clusters represent the rest of the ‘Top 50,’ providing a baseline that emphasizes just how unique the outliers truly are.
Here is a graph so you can visualize these players “prime”:






This visualization reconstructs the careers of seven NHL icons to reveal the biological reality of elite goal scoring. By mapping annual goal production against player age, the chart identifies a critical ‘Biological Prime’ window (ages 24–27), highlighted in grey, where athletic peak typically intersects with professional maturity. The trajectories offer a stark contrast in greatness: Wayne Gretzky and Mario Lemieux display ‘supernova’ profiles, reaching astronomical heights early in their careers before declining, while Gordie Howe and Jaromír Jágr represent the ‘marathon’ model, defying normal aging curves to remain productive into their 40s. Uniquely, Alex Ovechkin challenges the standard decline entirely, maintaining near-peak efficiency well into his late 30s, visually distinguishing him as the greatest ‘late-career’ scorer in history.








The NHL Immortals: Top 50 All-Time

Data: Official NHL Records (Top 50 Goal Scorers).








This table presents the fifty most prolific goal scorers in NHL history, revealing two distinct paths to hockey immortality: sheer longevity versus unprecedented efficiency. While Wayne Gretzky and Alex Ovechkin stand alone at the summit of total goals, the ‘Goals/Game’ column uncovers the hidden narrative of players like Mario Lemieux, who maintained a lethal scoring rate (0.75+) despite a career shortened by health issues. Conversely, legends such as Gordie Howe and Jaromír Jágr demonstrate how elite durability allows players to accumulate massive totals over decades. Ultimately, this dataset separates the ‘sprinters’ from the ‘marathon runners,’ showing that while 500 goals is the entry fee for this exclusive club, the method of achieving it varies wildly across eras.

title: About Me
text:
My name is Collin Gates, I am a 2nd year student at New College of Florida. I created this project on Janurary 15th, 2026 as a part of the Techne ISP with Preceptor David Kane.
This project includes some data about all-time hockey greats, such as Wayne Gretzky, and how their goal scoring totals changed throughout the years of their career.
Hockey Project GitHub
